question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and expert responses. Try to ensure that the code you generate is executable for demonstration. I want a family dynasty simulation game with a fictional background - no fantasy, gore, or horror elements, no urgent choices, and more focus on character development. I am the new family head (16 years old and unmarried), and the family includes my mother and underage sibling (brother or sister). The game includes ancient professions like officials, scholars, warriors, doctors, merchants, farmers, etc., and distinguishes between nobles and commoners. The game mainly focuses on marriage and household drama.

Reply settings: Each round should update the time and character information in a main interface, with all information enclosed in separate pseudo-code blocks. Use asterisks for prompts, quotation marks for dialogue, and add emoticons for expression. Use a tree diagram to show character relationships, and ensure code blocks fit mobile display dimensions. Reply 'next month' to advance to the next month, or 'restart' to regenerate character information.

checklist.title: Is the dynasty simulation core system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review if the code accurately implements the core dynasty simulation mechanics including time progression mechanism, character age tracking, family relationships management, and social class distinctions (nobles vs commoners). Score 0 if core simulation logic is missing, 5 if only basic time and character tracking exists, and 10 if the system fully models family dynamics, social status effects, and character development across time.

checklist.title: Are the character development systems properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate the implementation of character attributes, skills, and development paths related to the specified professions (officials, scholars, warriors, doctors, merchants, farmers). Check if characters have meaningful growth trajectories, realistic personality traits that affect decisions, and career progression mechanics. Deduct 5 points if profession mechanics are superficial, 3 points if character traits don't meaningfully impact gameplay. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the marriage and household drama system comprehensive?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code implements comprehensive marriage mechanics (courtship, arrangement, compatibility, consequences) and household drama events (conflicts, alliances, betrayals). Check for realistic social dynamics between family members and marriage prospects. Deduct 5 points if marriage is merely cosmetic without gameplay impact, 3 points if household events lack variety. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface follow the specified display requirements?
checklist.description: Verify that all the required interface elements are present: time display, character information in separate pseudo-code blocks, asterisks for prompts, quotation marks for dialogue, emoticons for expressions, and a tree diagram for character relationships. Check if all code blocks fit mobile display dimensions. Deduct 2 points for each missing element, with a minimum score of 0. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid user inputs, missing character data, unexpected state transitions, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Dynamic character personality evolution 2. Historical events integration 3. Family legacy achievements system). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple ways to track the same character stats) 2. Function modules unrelated to dynasty simulation (e.g., mini-games that don't contribute to the narrative) 3. Excessive details that affect readability (e.g., overly complex attribute calculations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating character management/event system/display logic), maintainability, and reuse potential. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if there's no clear state management architecture. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size â‰¥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Clear command feedback for 'next month' and 'restart' actions 2) Smooth transitions when updating character information and time progression 3) Readable and intuitive character relationship tree. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for cluttered information presentation, and 5 points for hard-to-follow narrative flow. The full score is 10 points.
